meanings.definition: A tool used for enlarging or shaping a hole.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a reamer to make the hole bigger.
meanings.sent2: I need a reamer to adjust the size of this hole.
meanings.sent3: The reamer made the hole so large, it could fit a basketball!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a reamer, widening the hole in the silence.
meanings.sent5: The reamer worked its magic, transforming the small hole into a spacious gap.

meanings.sent1: The reamer at the office always has a lot of paperwork to do.
meanings.sent2: She is the fastest reamer in the team when it comes to printing documents.
meanings.sent3: The reamer joked that they should start a 'Reamers Club' for all the paperwork.
meanings.sent4: He was a reamer of ideas, constantly churning out new concepts.
meanings.sent5: The reamer's efficiency in printing documents was unmatched by anyone else.

meanings.definition: A device for extracting juice from citrus fruits.
meanings.sent1: I used a reamer to get the juice out of the lemon.
meanings.sent2: The reamer made it easy to extract the orange juice.
meanings.sent3: The reamer seemed to dance on the lemon, squeezing out every drop of juice.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a reamer, extracting the truth from the situation.
meanings.sent5: The reamer's sharp edges effortlessly extracted the juice from the lime.
